title: Information regarding Tracey Collins and Eric Adams Communications.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to specific records related to Tracey Collins, Senior Youth Development Director for the New York City Department of Education, who has served as an elementary school principal. I am also requesting any communications related to Eric Adams, the current Mayor of New York City. I am requesting the following records under the Freedom of Information Law (FOIL):

All records related to Tracey Collins, including but not limited to:
Employment history with the New York City Department of Education
Performance evaluations
Salary information
Disciplinary actions
Any other personnel records maintained by the New York City Department of Education
Any and all communications related to Eric Adams, including but not limited to:
Emails
Text messages
Memos
Letters
Reports
Any other written or electronic communication
As a member of the public, I have a right to access these records to gain a better understanding of the professional conduct and performance of Ms. Collins and any communications related to the Mayor of New York City.

Please be advised that any attempt to withhold, redact, or destroy information related to this request will result in legal action and complaint. The failure to comply with FOIL is a serious matter and can result in both criminal and civil penalties. Therefore, I strongly urge you to comply with this request in a timely and complete manner.

Last, I would like to bring to your attention the case law supporting my request:

New York Times Co. v. U.S. Dep't of Justice, 756 F.3d 100, 117 (2d Cir. 2014) (holding that "the public has a vital interest in information regarding the operations of its government" and that the FOIA "embodies the basic principle that an informed citizenry is essential to democracy").

Matter of John P. v. Whalen, 54 N.Y.2d 89, 96 (1981) (stating that "FOIL expresses this State's strong commitment to open government and public accountability and imposes a broad duty on government to make its records available to the public").

Please note that any attempt to withhold, redact, or destroy information related to this request will result in legal action and complaint.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any record reflecting the total budget for producing and disseminating the DHS Science and Technology podcast Technologically Speaking.
https://www.dhs.gov/science-and-technology/technologically-speaking-podcast

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act. 

RECORDS REQUESTED:

All records related to political satirist Joseph Marcus Ruslander, better known by his stage name Mark Russell. He was born on 23 August 1932 in Buffalo, New York, USA and died on 30 March 2023. The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free via MuckRock.com, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. If you expect this request to exceed $25 in fees, please let me know prior to processing it. I would prefer that this request be fulfilled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

Thank you very much.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

title: Packaging Labels Rejected by the Cannabis Control Commission

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Packaging Labels Rejected by the Cannabis Control Commission
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Per the Advertising, Labeling, and Packaging regulatory requirements set forth 935 CMR 500.104 (4)-(6), the CCC must pre-approve a package or label. Please provide the following:

-The number of approved products to date since the recreational market opened (June 2018 to present), broken down by category.

-All images/photographs/files and information (as detailed in 935 CMR 500.104 (7)(b)(1)-(2)) pertaining to proposed packaging and/or labels that have been rejected by the CCC since the recreational market opened (June 2018 to present), including the specific reasons for the rejection.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Faraone
